page_content:
# Bug report

- [x] I confirm this is a bug with Supabase, not with my own application. 
- [x] I confirm I have searched the [Docs](https://docs.supabase.com), GitHub [Discussions](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions), and [Discord](https://discord.supabase.com). 

## Describe the bug

Docker setup with traefik for supabase storage module does not use `SITE_URL` or `SUPABASE_PUBLIC_URL` to generate its object URLs, storage is broken with `500 internal error` if  its not `kong:8000` and uses this to generate broken urls which should have been `{SUPABASE_PUBLIC_URL}/storage/v1/object/public/{bucket}/{object}`  as seen in the screenshot below

If the `SUPABASE_URL` env variable is set to SUPABASE_PUBLIC_URL this breaks api quickstart but, only works with `SUPABASE_URL` set to `kong:8000` generates api refrences using public_url variable.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. checkout `docker-compose.yml` at [gist#292fec0885a7e28475f39e9ffdfe9a80](https://gist.github.com/sujaykumarh/292fec0885a7e28475f39e9ffdfe9a80)
2. `traefik service` is a [simple reverse proxy](https://gist.github.com/sujaykumarh/fe7aca2830c75d19bd8e4d2d19a10795) running on `:80` using `traefik-public` as network.
3. `volumes` directory is exact copy at `supabase/supabase/docker/volumes`
4. use the `.env` from gist for replication 

## Expected behavior

when a file is uploaded to storage bucket _public/private_ in this case i used a `public` bucket called `test`. Supabase URL should have been `http://supabase.localhost/storage/v1/object/public/test/sample.png` instead it generates `http://kong:8000/storage/v1/object/public/test/sample.png` and uses the `kong:8000` url for preview request in studio

in my test case the `SUPABASE_KONG_URL` is used for testing behavior

## Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14109141/232742488-3130b6ad-7b88-4118-845c-cb22744ca5f4.png)

on clicking `Get URL` button also copies same `http://kong:8000/storage/v1/object/public/test/sample.png` url to clipboard

## System information

- OS: Linux with docker
- Browser: n/a
- Version of supabase: [supabase/docker-compose.yml](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/blob/master/docker/docker-compose.yml) versions
- Version of Node.js: n/a

## Additional context

Nothing much was changed apart from using traefik with default project `docker-compose.yml` file. hard-coded versions were seperated to `.env` for easier version changes with defaults to project [current docker-compose.yml](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/blob/d9f7d2982be68a45628c95b3fda7443463692132/docker/docker-compose.yml) file versions.

metadata.title: Storage URLs are broken on Docker + traefik [self hosted]
metadata.creator: sujaykumarh

metadata.title: Correction for "Migrating and Upgrading Projects" storage script
metadata.creator: tourbillonlabs

page_content:
# Bug report

- [x] I confirm this is a bug with Supabase, not with my own application. 
- [x] I confirm I have searched the [Docs](https://docs.supabase.com), GitHub [Discussions](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions), and [Discord](https://discord.supabase.com). 

## Describe the bug

I created a materialized view along with a function to refresh it and a few triggers.  The update function returns an error that says "must be owner of materialized view department_monthly_fees".

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Create a materialized view using the SQL Editor from within the Supabase frontend
2. Create a function that updates the materialized view using the SQL Editor
```
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION refresh_department_monthly_fees()
RETURNS TRIGGER AS $$
BEGIN
  REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW department_monthly_fees;
  RETURN NEW;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;
```
3. Create a trigger that will call the refresh function
```
CREATE TRIGGER refresh_department_monthly_fees_departments
AFTER INSERT OR UPDATE OR DELETE
ON departments
FOR EACH STATEMENT
EXECUTE FUNCTION refresh_department_monthly_fees();
```
4. Alter the table for the trigger, causing the refresh function fire
5. See error: "must be owner of materialized view department_monthly_fees" .  I can see this as a response in my browser when I try to alter the department_monthly_fees

## Expected behavior

The refresh function should fire, updating the materialized view

## What I tried

1. I tried altering the view owner from the SQL editor:
```
alter materialized view department_monthly_fees owner to authenticated;
```
Result: Failed to run sql query: permission denied for schema public

2. I paused my project and restored it, which caused PostgreSQL to update to version 15.  I then tried to recreate my materialized view with security invoker:
```
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW department_monthly_fees WITH (security_invoker) AS
...
```
Result: Failed to run sql query: unrecognized parameter "security_invoker"

## System information

- PostgreSQL Version: 15 now (tried on 14, then updated and trying in 15 now)

metadata.title: must be owner of materialized view
metadata.creator: dilly-sixmo

page_content:
## New Feature: Column-level Privileges Management in Supabase Dashboard

This Pull Request introduces a new feature for managing column-level privileges in the Supabase Dashboard. With this enhancement, users can now seamlessly view and modify table privileges for each role.

### Key Benefits
Column-level security comes in handy when you want to grant specific actions to certain roles, but restrict access to specific columns. For instance, this is particularly useful when you allow authenticated users to insert or update records but want to prevent them from modifying the values of certain critical columns (e.g. `created_at` or `updated_at`).

### Features include
- Effortlessly view and edit column-level privileges in the dashboard
- Improve security and control by specifying permissions per column for each role
- Enhance overall flexibility and customization in managing database access and operations

Here is a quick demo:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6322901/232219207-8ff4ef91-fd02-4c47-8c59-4b03c6eeb8f5.mp4

metadata.title: feat(dashboard): Add column-level privileges management
metadata.creator: HTMHell

"rawError": "{\"_error\":{\"name\":\"KnexTimeoutError\"},\"name\":\"KnexTimeoutError\",\"message\":\"Knex: Timeout acquiring a connection. The pool is probably full. Are you missing a .transacting(trx) call?\",\"stack\":\"KnexTimeoutError: Knex: Timeout acquiring a connection. The pool is probably full. Are you missing a .transacting(trx) call?\\n    at Client_PG.acquireConnection (/app/node_modules/knex/lib/client.js:312:26)\\n    at runNextTicks (node:internal/process/task_queues:60:5)\\n    at listOnTimeout (node:internal/timers:538:9)\\n    at process.processTimers (node:internal/timers:512:7)\\n    at async Transaction_PG.acquireConnection (/app/node_modules/knex/lib/execution/transaction.js:250:28)\"}",

This happened after asking to be enabled in the resumable uploads beta but it appears as if theres a breaking change for existing uploads?

# Bug report

<!-- 

⚠️ We receive a lot of bug reports which have already been solved or discussed. If you are looking for help, please try these first:

- Docs: https://docs.supabase.com
- Discussions: https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions
- Discord: https://discord.supabase.com

Before opening a bug report, please verify the following: 

-->

- [X] I confirm this is a bug with Supabase, not with my own application. 
- [X] I confirm I have searched the [Docs](https://docs.supabase.com), GitHub [Discussions](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions), and [Discord](https://discord.supabase.com). 

## Describe the bug

I have two webhooks. One that triggers upon an insert and one that triggers upon an update. When I insert or update a record on the relevant table, the webhooks are not firing. I am testing by passing the webhooks an ngrok url. When I hit this ngrok url with `curl`, it runs as expected so this appears to be an issue with Supabase.

When I look in the `net` table, I am noticing that each webhook request that _should_ have fired, is just sitting in the `http_request_queue` table. I do see a single record in the `_http_response` table.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Set up a webhook
2. Trigger the webhook
3.  Check the http_request_queue table

## Expected behavior

Webhook should hit provided url

## System information

We spun up this Supabase instance within the past 2 weeks.
Both HTTP and PG_NET extensions are enabled.

## Additional Context
We also spun up a Supabase instance before the current one, and as far as I know it had more or less the same configuration. The webhooks _were_ working with this instance.

metadata.title: Webhook stopped firing. Instead, indefinitely queuing in http_request_queue
metadata.creator: bryceAebi

## Describe the bug
- I upgraded via `brew` to the latest supabase CLI 1.50.2 . I was on maybe ~1.39 or so before.
- I used the Supabase Web UI to set up some policies. I ran the migration script: `supabase db diff add_policies -f add_policies`
- This placed some curious items in my migration file:
```
alter table "auth"."users" drop column "deleted_at";

alter table "auth"."users" alter column "phone" set data type character varying(15) using "phone"::character varying(15);

alter table "auth"."users" alter column "phone_change" set data type character varying(15) using "phone_change"::character varying(15);
```
I did not modify this schema at all. I've seen this happen before and learned to just trust Supabase
- I applied the schema and deployed
- HARD down time via the `signInWithOtp` method (I suspect all of supabase might have been failing but this is what helped me find the issue). 
- I was getting the error: "User not found" (via the above method). 
- After frantically searching, I dug into the auth logs on the Supabase site and saw an error saying something like "deleted_at on user does not exist)
- I manually added it via the Supabase prod web UI and stuff worked. 

Sorry if this isn't a Supabase CLI issue but any idea why those migration items showed up in my file? This sort of thing happens -  supabase-internal field changes showing up in my migration files... and I have no idea if I should trust it or not - I've been trusting it and this was the first issue but it was a pretty bad issue.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Go to '…'
2. Click on '…'
3. Scroll down to '…'
4. See error

## Expected behavior

page_content:
## What kind of change does this PR introduce?

Bug fix/accessibility improvement

## What is the current behavior?

I noticed when tabbing through the .com site that certain elements would actually require two tabs to get to the next element. This is due to the `<a>` tag that is being rendered around the `<Button>` component, since both are tabbable.

![Before change - Button-styled anchors require 2 tabs](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/assets/11774799/4fa8e8dc-5897-4712-8135-190ad1d9b156)

## What is the new behavior?

For accessibility purposes, all of these should be represented as links since they take you to another page, so I've removed the wrapping `a` or `Link` components.
 
The `Button` component already has an `as` prop to allow it to be rendered as any basic HTML element, but it didn't have the typing to support props that `a` elements have, which lead to people using `ts-ignore` comments. Based on some types in `ui-box` and @MildTomato's suggestion, I added a more advanced type that better supports polymorphism using the `as` prop.

![After change - elements only require 1 tab](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/assets/11774799/ca2b21c6-7f4b-458f-8b84-26864d74dc18)

## Additional context

The original issue with using `Button`s that were links throwing errors in the studio (https://github.com/supabase/supabase/pull/13540#issuecomment-1505152745) should be fixed now with the ref changes in https://github.com/supabase/supabase/pull/13580 - the `SignInLayout` in the studio package is no longer throwing a runtime error, so this should be safe to move forward with 🎉

metadata.title: fix: Buttons wrapped in Links should just be styled anchor tags
metadata.creator: brandongregoryscott

# Bug report

## Describe the bug

I have a bucket called "images" in which common media files are stored. Inside this bucket is a folder (see image, in this case it's called "hl-posts"), in which I want to store related, but different kinds of files. I used the supabase storage API to upload ~1600 images into said subfolder, but when I navigate only the first 199 are shown there. When I scroll all the way down, no additional files are loaded. However, when I continue scrolling in the first column (the bucket "images"), the files that should appear at the bottom of "hl-posts" are loaded instead of the files inside the bucket.

By trying to access the files over the CDN I have confirmed that the files are located inside the folder (and can be accessed without problems), they are simply not loaded in the right column.

Clicking on a media file that is wrongfully displayed in the left column shows no preview.

## Screenshots

The following screenshot should clear up things:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32516822/229577342-30fb12b2-2808-44f4-a8b6-81c0d8a6ccbe.png)

## To Reproduce

1. Create a bucket
2. Add a folder in said bucket
3. Upload >200 files into bucket
4. Upload >200 files into folder inside bucket
5. Try to scroll down inside folder to see it doesn't work
6. Click inside left column (bucket), then scroll down: it should show the contents of the folder INSTEAD of the actual contents of the bucket

## Expected behavior

Scrolling down inside a folder inside a bucket should load the correct files.

## System information

- OS: Windows
- Browser: latest version of Vivaldi (Chromium)
- Version of supabase-js: 2.10.0
- Version of Node.js: 19.0.0

metadata.title: Storage Bucket Contents Scrolling Bug (Dashboard)
metadata.creator: hansfuchs

# Bug report

- [x] I confirm this is a bug with Supabase, not with my own application. 
- [x] I confirm I have searched the [Docs](https://docs.supabase.com), GitHub [Discussions](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions), and [Discord](https://discord.supabase.com). 

## Describe the bug

I cannot retrieve a logged-in user on the back-end anymore. On the front-end a session is created, and on the back-end the auth token is used in `getUser(authToken)` to retrieve the user. This returns `null`. I'm using NodeJs and I upgraded to supabase 1.47.2 (through homebrew). Before this I was running supabase 1.11.0 and it was working fine.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Run locally the latest version of supabase CLI (1.47.2) and use that for your local db environment, and the npm package `@supabase/supabase-js` on the latest version (2.13.1)
2. Create a session for a user that is registered `session = await supabase.auth.getSession();`
3. Use the access token `authToken = session.data.session.access_token` to `await supabase.auth.getUser(authToken)`
4. The `data.user` returned from `getUser` is `null` with the error message `AuthApiError: Invalid authentication credentials`

## Expected behavior

The user is authenticated as the JWT is a valid session token, so the back-end should just retrieve the user session like normal

## System information

- OS: macOS Venture 13.2.1
- Browser (if applies): Chrome 111.0.5563.110 (Official Build) (x86_64)
- Version of supabase CLI: 1.47.2
- Version of supabase-js: 2.13.1
- Version of Node.js: 19.8.1

metadata.title: Auth bug: unable to getUser(jwt) on the back-end in latest supabase CLI version (1.47.2)

page_content:
## Hello! 

I'm starting a new project using SvelteKit and Supabase. Pretty standard stuff to be honest. 
I am currently adding authentication and authorization to my application. I've followed the Supabase documentation and got stuck in the "protecting multiple routes" part because the app didn't run as expected. 

## The problem
If you follow the Supabase documentation and then try to check the protected route, the browser won't redirect you as stated in the example.  
The docs I am talking about: 
https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-helpers/sveltekit#protecting-multiple-routes

## Solution?
I've spent all the afternoon trying to find the problem... and I think I found it!!
By default, SvelteKit prerender every single page you create. That means SvelteKit is creating the HTML at build time. I am not an expert on the subject but I think prerendering protected routes might be the problem. To solve this issue, I just had to set prerendering to false. I created a "+layout.server.ts" file inside the route folder I wanted to protect and added the next line:

```typescript
// src/routes/dashboard/+layout.server.ts
export const prerender = false;
```
After that, the app behaved like I wanted from the start. If I try to go to "/dashboard" I get redirected to the landing page. That's fantastic. 

## Improvement

To be honest, I don't know why changing the prerender value to false solves my issue, but I think it is important to acknowledge this weird behavior. I am sure the Supabase team is able to figure it out. 
By now, I think the best thing to do is to update the docs and inform the developer about this problem. 

I hope this helps!

metadata.title: Protecting multiple routes using SvelteKit is not working as expected
metadata.creator: Chemchu

await supabase.from('customers').select('*, customer_addresses(*)')

page_content:
# Improve documentation

## Link 

https://supabase.com/blog/openai-embeddings-postgres-vector

## Describe the problem

The example does not work because there is a parameter mismatch.

The signature of the postgres function is `match_documents(match_count, query_embedding, similarity_threshold)`

but the rpc call looks for `match_documents(match_count, match_threshold, query_embedding)`

## Describe the improvement

replace mentions of `match_threshold` with `similarity_threshold`

I prefer "similarity" because conveys inexactness.

## Additional context

It's a small fix so if you're happy with my suggestions I can file a PR right away.

metadata.title: fix: match_threshold
metadata.creator: kagia

page_content:
# Bug report

<!-- 

⚠️ We receive a lot of bug reports which have already been solved or discussed. If you are looking for help, please try these first:

- Docs: https://docs.supabase.com
- Discussions: https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions
- Discord: https://discord.supabase.com

Before opening a bug report, please verify the following: 

-->

- [x] I confirm this is a bug with Supabase, not with my own application. 
- [x] I confirm I have searched the [Docs](https://docs.supabase.com), GitHub [Discussions](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions), and [Discord](https://discord.supabase.com). 

## Describe the bug

In Postgres 15, the `NULLS NOT DISTINCT` syntax was introduced. However, queries including this syntax fail in Studio - both on CLI and app.supabase.com

## To Reproduce

1. Create a new database, either via app.supabase.com or with supabase CLI
2. Go to the SQL editor
3. Run a command that includes the `NULLS NOT DISTINCT` syntax
    ```
    CREATE TABLE new_style (
      id BIGINT GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
      val1 TEXT NOT NULL,
      val2 TEXT NULL,
      CONSTRAINT uq_val1_val2_new UNIQUE NULLS NOT DISTINCT (val1, val2)
    );
   ```    
   It will fail with `Failed to validate sql query: syntax error at or near "NULLS"`
4. Or create a table and try to add a constraint
    ```
    CREATE TABLE new_style (
      id BIGINT GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
      val1 TEXT NOT NULL,
      val2 TEXT NULL
    );
    ALTER TABLE new_style ADD CONSTRAINT uq_val1_val2_new UNIQUE NULLS NOT DISTINCT (val1, val2);
    ```
5. Connect to the database with a client like Postico, and the command will work ok.

## Expected behavior

It is expected that the SQL Editor validates the `NULLS NOT DISTINCT` syntax correctly.

## Additional context

There are 2 reports in discord but no bug reports here.

- https://discord.com/channels/839993398554656828/1056281310458544239/1056281310458544239
- https://discord.com/channels/839993398554656828/1056281310458544239/1056285615471214643

metadata.title: Valid query containing `UNIQUE NULLS NOT DISTINCT` is not validated
metadata.creator: data-envoy

page_content: # Bug report - [x] I confirm this is a bug with Supabase, not with my own application. - [x] I confirm I have searched the [Docs](https://docs.supabase.com), GitHub [Discussions](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions), and [Discord](https://discord.supabase.com). ## Describe the bug TL;DR: updating a table with the table editor delete the composite foreign key constraint on the table More context I create two table, the first one with a composite primary key and the second one with the composite foreign key to reference the first table. If I edit the table on the dashboard (even if I edit nothing) and click on save, an error pop-up and the relation is deleted post update. I am conscious that composite foreign keys are not supported by the dashboard but updating the table, without editing this constraint, should not delete it. ## To Reproduce 1. Create the two table mentioned above - `table1` has the composite primary key - `table2` has the composite foreign key 2. Create a composite foreign key constraint with SQL editor ```sql ALTER TABLE table2 ADD CONSTRAINT table1_fkey FOREIGN KEY (id_table1, date_table1) REFERENCES table1(id, date); ``` 3. See that the constraint has been created (used `psql` cli with `\d [table_name]`) ``` Table "public.table2" Column | Type | Collation | Nullable | Default -------------+--------------------------+-----------+----------+---------------------------------- id | bigint | | not null | generated by default as identity created_at | timestamp with time zone | | | now() id_table1 | bigint | | | date_table1 | date | | | Indexes: "table2_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id) Foreign-key constraints: "table1_fkey" FOREIGN KEY (id_table1, date_table1) REFERENCES table1(id, date) Policies (row security enabled): (none) ``` 3. Update the table on the dashboard - Go to Table edit view - Click on drop down arrow next to the table name - Click edit table - Add a new column (here a column `name`) or do nothing - Click "Save" 4. See errors Theses errors seams to imply that the dashboard tried to re-create the foreign key constraints but since the target column does not have a `UNIQUE` constraint, the error pops-up and the foreign key is just skipped. If the table match the `UNIQUE` constraints 5. See the constraint is not available ``` Table "public.table2" Column | Type | Collation | Nullable | Default -------------+--------------------------+-----------+----------+---------------------------------- id | bigint | | not null | generated by default as identity created_at | timestamp with time zone | | | now() id_table1 | bigint | | | date_table1 | date | | | name | text | | | Indexes: "table2_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id) Policies (row security enabled): (none) ``` ## Expected behavior The update of the table (name / description) or other column than the one included in the composite foreign key should not affect existing constraints. For exemple, only adding or updating a column with the designated button (Database -> Tables -> click on "X Columns" -> Add column OR Edit button of one column) does not trigger the error. The best would be a support of composite foreign keys but that's not the point here. ## System information - OS: macOs - Browser: chrome

metadata.title: Updating a table with the table editor delete the composite foreign key constraint on the table
metadata.creator: atrahy

{{ session?.user?.email }}

``` Got an error in Login.vue ```js //Existing const { error } = await supabase.auth.signIn({ email: email.value }) //This fixed it const { error } = await supabase.auth.signInWithOtp({ email: email.value }) ``` Getting this error, not sure what to do ```js //Error [Vue warn]: Component : setup function returned a promise, but no boundary was found in the parent component tree. A component with async setup() must be nested in a in order to be rendered. at //I tried this in App.vue, still not resolved ``` I'm stuck here: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45961072/227933396-46d47a08-3512-45c3-879b-ea29751d0e13.png) ### Additional info needed in the doc - [This file, /store isn't mentioned in the docs](https://github.com/mhartington/supabase-ionic-vue/blob/main/src/store/index.ts) - In many sections [like these,](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/getting-started/tutorials/with-ionic-vue#set-up-a-login-route) the file name isn't mentioned (I need to copy-paste this, but where?)

page_content:
# Bug report

<!-- 

⚠️ We receive a lot of bug reports which have already been solved or discussed. If you are looking for help, please try these first:

- Docs: https://docs.supabase.com
- Discussions: https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions
- Discord: https://discord.supabase.com

Before opening a bug report, please verify the following: 

-->

- [x ] I confirm this is a bug with Supabase, not with my own application. 
- [x ] I confirm I have searched the [Docs](https://docs.supabase.com), GitHub [Discussions](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/discussions), and [Discord](https://discord.supabase.com). 

## Describe the bug

Hi,  I have noticed that if you have a Postgres database with only `Foreign Tables` and zero "normal" tables it will show say there are zero tables in the studio page.

However, adding a single table then allows the Foreign Tables to be viewed.  (see screenshots below)

In my testing I have noticed that if you copy the URL of the view for the `Foreign Table` and then delete the "normal" table it still lets you view the data inside while still listing that there is no clickable view.

## Expected behavior

Superbase should be listing the `Foreign Tables` (providing there is 1 or more) without needing at least one normal table.

## Screenshots

Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30593259/227351841-5e315191-38eb-4e61-b989-eb77832ae402.png)

After adding a single table it then shows both Foreign Tables and also normal tables.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30593259/227352412-00e52bfb-0559-470e-a534-731b29780ccb.png)

Deleting the temporary table and going to the URL:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30593259/227355277-0ca6453c-c6da-4d73-8976-b4958a576a6f.png)


## System information

- OS: Linux/Docker
- Browser (if applies) Chrome
- Version of supabase-js: (docker image supabase/studio:20230216-e731b77)

metadata.title: Unable to view Foreign Tables unless one or more real table exisits
metadata.creator: AdamKearn

# Bug report

## Describe the bug

I was having a fully working supabase instance in my digital ocean droplet, However I did faced a previous issue that I didn't know where I should point, so I thought that I should update/edit the digitalocean token & spaces key, I deleted previous ones from dashboard, then created the new ones, then opened the console UI of my droplet.

`digitalocean.ini` file where i did updated the digitalocean token:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25140579/226147550-e7993070-64b9-4ee3-a84e-3fcd12b4466f.png)

`.env` file where I did updated the spaces keys:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25140579/226147629-f4f3712d-620a-4f60-9c89-a1dc8cb02095.png)

 
I'am sure the keys which are there does exists in the dashboard of digitalocean!

After that I runned `docker-compose.yml up -d` to apply updates.

and other supabase studio aspects such database and auth still works fine, but in the storage when I do try to upload a file it shows me :
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25140579/226147786-3f2c685d-9a1a-4b93-a82c-1f07cdc52c0e.png)

it shows me "accessDenied" but I don't seem to specify what is wrong exactly and what I did wrong or is it even related the leys or other thing, please help me, supabase resources are very limited.  

**update:**
when I do check the console of the browser at this point, I see those permissions 404 errors:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25140579/226150615-24489cc5-b808-4fdb-9d2b-3f566b7a047f.png)
 

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Deploying a supabase instance with docker with custom `.env`
2. using the instance, asd ensuring all things working as expected
3. updating `.env` and other keys.
4. running `docker-compose up -d`, to apply changes0

## Expected behavior

At this point, I expect that the while supabase instance got updated with new changes, but the issue happens.
I don't changed anything related to authentication or permissions, I did changed keys related tp storage, which don't work and don't allow for uploading files either from studio or by SDK clients.

## System information

- droplet OS: ubuntu
- Browser   chrome.

## Additional context

I don't know exactly where to look in order to get some debugging logs to point the main issue so it can give more context, I'am sure that the supabase instance did worked fine before, I appreciate any kind of informations that can help me or guide me.

metadata.title: Supabase studio don't allow uploads after change of the digitalocean token & sapces key
metadata.creator: anasfik

                        ^
   7 |

## Describe the bug Vite build failure, error 500 ## To Reproduce Build Failure in the Quickstart guide after adding +layout.svelte, after `npm run dev` type generation ## Screenshots If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. ## System information MacOS, latest sveltekit build 
"devDependencies": {
		"@playwright/test": "^1.28.1",

	},

	"dependencies": {
		"@supabase/auth-helpers-sveltekit": "^0.9.0",
		"@supabase/auth-ui-shared": "^0.1.3",
		"@supabase/auth-ui-svelte": "^0.1.4",
		"@supabase/supabase-js": "^2.11.0"
	}
## Additional context [Relevant TypeScript changes 4.7>4.9](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-4-9/) ### lib.d.ts Updates While TypeScript strives to avoid major breaks, even small changes in the built-in libraries can cause issues. We don’t expect major breaks as a result of DOM and lib.d.ts updates, but there may be some small ones. ### Better Types for Promise.resolve Promise.resolve now uses the Awaited type to unwrap Promise-like types passed to it. **This means that it more often returns the right Promise type, but that improved type can break existing code if it was expecting `any` or unknown instead of a Promise.** For more information, [see the original change](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/pull/33074). `supabase: SupabaseClient;` ### JavaScript Emit No Longer Elides Imports When TypeScript first supported type-checking and compilation for JavaScript, it accidentally supported a feature called import elision. In short, if an import is not used as a value, or the compiler can detect that the import doesn’t refer to a value at runtime, the compiler will drop the import during emit. This behavior was questionable, especially the detection of whether the import doesn’t refer to a value, since it means that TypeScript has to trust sometimes-inaccurate declaration files. In turn, TypeScript now preserves imports in JavaScript files. ### [Recent Changes in SvelteKit Type Safety 03-9-2023](https://svelte.dev/blog/zero-config-type-safety) ## $types.d.ts `export type LayoutData = Expand>>> & OptionalUnion>>>>>;`

metadata.title: latest sveltekit framework quickstarts, +layout.svelte error

page_content:
https://github.com/supabase/supabase/blob/755409c0c8eeca2ca83c5ea13986e0f6f79d44b4/docker/docker-compose.yml#L229

Wouldn't it be best to default for the compose to bind to `127.0.0.1` instead of potentially exposing the port to the internet? as most of the communication is done through docker networking unless the user knows they will be exposing the database to the internet.

This is presuming the user is not deploying with a firewall infront (which is rare) but I don't see why we need to expose it.

```
    ports:
      # Pass down internal port because it's set dynamically by other services
      - 127.0.0.1:${POSTGRES_PORT}:${POSTGRES_PORT}
```

OR in the secure section we can mention it there https://supabase.com/docs/guides/self-hosting/docker?

Let me know your thoughts

metadata.title: Change docker compose DB exposed ports
metadata.creator: LaurenceJJones

page_content:
# Bug report

We have started to getting an error - `SSL connection timeout` - and only in the hosted supabase.

## Describe the bug

#### Postman to API
Same as the team. Works consistently and as expected both on the local and hosted API endpoints.

#### Supabase to API

This shows success when going directly (using Postman) to the external api. This is the same api that is being called from within supabase / postgres via the use of the `http` extension, specifically using `http_put`.

When calling the `private.connect_accounting_contact(contactName, contactEmail)`  from within the Supabase SQL editor: 

Supabase Instance | Accounting API | Status | Result
-- | -- | -- | --
Local | Local | OK | Works consistently and as expected. Returns an id string on success, and a null value when the user name has already been taken.
Local | Hosted | OK | As above
Hosted | Local | OK | As above
Hosted | Hosted | FAIL | Inconsistent behaviour. Initially would allow some contacts to be created, and return null for already created contacts. Then started to throw the Failed to run sql query: SSL connection timeout error consistently. On further testing, only throws this error now, so no contacts are being created at all.



## To Reproduce

The postgres function body is using `http_put`.

## Expected behavior

Expect to get a http 200 status, and for it to work consistently across the different environments. 

## Screenshots

From the Supabase console:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2173213/225121150-d037dfc1-bdbb-4114-8d80-341e03b14844.png)


And using Postman
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2173213/225121236-54395381-cccd-44ce-9d27-092c6b102c72.png)


## System information

Supabase hosted _only_.

metadata.title: SSL connection timeout in hosted Supabase
metadata.creator: magick93

# Bug report

## Describe the bug

The User Management Starter SQL script is wrong. It is clearly meant to set the id primary key equal to that of auth.uid(). However, it generates a completely new UUID creating a data inconsistency.


## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Go to 'The SQL editor inside your project dashboard'
2. Click on 'Welcome'
3. Scroll down to 'Quick start and select User Management Starter '

## Expected behavior

When the query is triggered, new profiles should be assigned auth.uid() as id and primary key. 

## Additional context

Related to it, in the [Next tutorial ](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/getting-started/tutorials/with-nextjs), you're asked to select the query and run it as is which makes it clear it is not the desired behavior. To fix this I had to use this snippet provided in [this example](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/managing-user-data)

metadata.title: Fix User Management Starter SQL Script
metadata.creator: storialp

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

I'm currently using Twilio as phone provider and it works well for sending OTP via SMS. However, every OTP sent via SMS costs money and it doesn't make sense to spend credit during the testing phase. Is there a way to generate the OTP for a user via the Supabase dashboard, e.g. the SQL Editor?

## Additional context

The users will be testing the app I'm currently building in staging. Before asking the client to subscribe to a paid Twilio plan, I want to make sure there is a way to reduce costs, i.e. the client is only charged for SMS in production but not staging. Since it's a pay-as-you-go plan, I fear the costs will get pretty high during stress tests.

page_content:
# Bug report
- kong.yml is created as a directory, although it seems it was resolved about a year ago
- `db` service is written in the docker-compose.yml file and makes it difficult to use the GitHub repository as a starting point for Docker if you want to detach the db, as the tutorial says (ex: in Portainer, with composer override + fork repo is not enough) 
- no clear instructions on how to get the database working with initialization or migrations. 
- not clear what needs to be done in any step, very confusing instructions regarding detached DB
- just trying to start supabase as it is in docker/docker-compose.yml with some env vars doesn't work
- got the studio to work, but gets stuck on default project screen, a lot of 404 errors from `/rest/v1/` and `/api/profile/permissions`
- no explanations on what needs to change in all the env, compose files etc in case your 8000 port is already used on your server. one must search through issues and google and solutions don't work
- very little support on "common issues"
- lots of env variables not explained, have no clue what to change or when or why
- database doesn't connect in the containers, even with the normal database (not detached)

## Describe the bug
I don't think they are bugs, because some people got it working, but the information is so minimal, that's almost impossible to succeed by yourself.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Go to [supabase](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/self-hosting)
2. Try to follow the instructions
3. Battle the Lords of Hell, jump over all the problems, fail, repeat, fail again
4. See all kinds of errors in all supabase created containers
5. Watch your beautiful supabase studio doing nothing, feel sad, write an issue on GitHub 

## Expected behavior
Have a comprehensive step-by-step, maybe some common problems and solutions, explain the detached stuff better etc

## System information

- OS: [e.g. macOS, Windows] Ubuntu 22.04
- Browser (if applies) [e.g. chrome, safari] all
- Version of supabase-js: [e.g. 6.0.2] didn't get there
- Version of Node.js: [e.g. 10.10.0] the one installed from supabase docker-compose

## Additional context
I don't like to say it, but nothing works :(
**Love this project**, _but need more information / documentation. Pretty PLEASE_

metadata.title: Better documentation on self hosted setup
metadata.creator: cristian-milea

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug
I followed the Supabase tutorial: https://supabase.com/blog/transparent-column-encryption-with-postgres to encrypt the password field in the email table. I tried this:

CREATE TABLE emails (
	id bigserial primary key,
        email text,
  	password text,
	key_id uuid not null DEFAULT 'e348034b-3f07-4878-aad6-000511d12826'::uuid,
  	nonce bytea default pgsodium.crypto_aead_det_noncegen()
);

This succeeds, then I move on to:

SECURITY LABEL FOR pgsodium
	ON COLUMN emails.password
  	IS 'ENCRYPT WITH KEY COLUMN key_id NONCE nonce';

Error: **Failed to run sql query: must be owner of event trigger pgsodium_trg_mask_update**

Then I tried to Google and change the owner as suggested by other users and tutorials. For example https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-altereventtrigger.html

Problem is that I cannot find this trigger in Triggers. I tried: 

ALTER EVENT TRIGGER pgsodium_trg_mask_update OWNER to postgres

Error: Failed to run sql query: must be owner of event trigger pgsodium_trg_mask_update

I am out of options, How did the writer of the tutorial make this work?

## To Reproduce

Follow https://supabase.com/blog/transparent-column-encryption-with-postgres

## Expected behavior

Password column encrypted

## Screenshots

See code examples above

## System information

Linux (Fedora 37) + Supabase Dashboard in Chromium

metadata.title: Transparent Column Encryption does not work (permission/ownership issue)
metadata.creator: jstdk

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

The dialog for inviting members to an organization (on the hosted / app.supabase.com instance) is a bit jarring because the required email field validates immediately. If you click on the dropdown to select a role, or if you simply click off of the email input that is auto-focused when you open the dialog, it will mark the field as invalid. 

I dug into the code a bit and it seems like this may be intentional, or at least it's *consistent* across components that leverage this `Form` component and a validator: https://github.com/supabase/supabase/blob/ab9639064639023768a3479d0703c0921d03cad4/packages/ui/src/components/Form/Form.tsx#L41

How does the team feel about this? It feels like it should only update the validation state once the call-to-action button is clicked.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. After logging in, click on an organization on the left sidebar
1. Click on the 'Team' tab to visit the team management page
1. Click on the 'Invite' button to open the dialog
1. Click on the role dropdown OR click in the blank space in the dialog
1. Notice the email field immediately change to invalid

## Expected behavior

Since I have not yet completed the form, I would not expect validation errors to show up until I click the call-to-action button.

## Screenshots

![invite-member-button](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11774799/224186923-7c82c100-efd2-4415-a1c1-83283ff89b09.gif)


## System information

- OS: macOS 12.3
- Browser (if applies) Chrome 110.0.5481.177 (Official Build) (arm64) 
- Version of supabase-js: N/A
- Version of Node.js: N/A

## Additional context

N/A

metadata.title: Organization > Team > Invite Member Dialog validates on blur, causing jarring form UX
metadata.creator: brandongregoryscott

# Bug report

## Describe the bug

I'm seeing intermittent connection issues when making requests with `supabase-js` which seem to look like connection issues between the `postgrest` container and the `postgres` container. 

## To Reproduce

I'm running a self-hosted docker instance of Supabase. Some requests come back with the following errors:

```
{ code: '', details: null, hint: null, message: '' }
```
```
{
  code: 'PGRST001',
  details: 'no connection to the server\n',
  hint: null,
  message: 'Database client error. Retrying the connection.'
}
```
Looking at the logs for PostgREST I saw the following:
```
09/Mar/2023:13:12:17 +0000: Attempting to connect to the database...
10.0.12.24 - service_role [09/Mar/2023:13:12:17 +0000] "POST /foo_table HTTP/1.1" 503 - "" "node-fetch/1.0 (+https://github.com/bitinn/node-fetch)"
```

## Expected behavior

Intermittent connection issues shouldn't happen

## Screenshots

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

## System information

- OS: Alpine Linux / Docker
- Version of supabase-js: 2.10.0
- Version of Node.js: 16

## Additional context

FWIW - I've also seen some console errors in the UI portion of the app that also have 503 codes related to supabase queries/operations. I suspect these are related.

metadata.title: Connection Issues Between PostgREST and Database
metadata.creator: kevinmlong

Looking for something? 🔍

``` ## To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository: 1. Setup new supabase docker install 2. Click on Storage tab (`http://localhost:3000/project/default/storage/buckets`) 3. Observe error message and network tab in browser ## Expected behavior Should load buckets json ## System information - OS: fedora - Browser (if applies) firefox, chrome - Version of supabase-js: idk, latest supabase/studio:20230228-029c7bd - Version of Node.js: [e.g. 10.10.0]

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

Comments added to tables or columns are not included in the diff when a migration is created from that database. This results in being unable to document tables, as any comments in the dev db will be lost when it is next reset, and none of the dev db comments can be propagated to staging/prod because they're not part of the migration files.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Use the example countries SQL to create a new countries table with comment descriptions for the table and each column in your local dev db. (Accessible from a hosted supabase project => SQL editor => Welcome => Quickstart => Countries)
2. Run `supabase db diff -f add_countries` to generate a migration for that countries table.

## Expected behavior

Expect the generated migration to include the commands to create the table, any indexes that were defined, and all comments, as per:

```sql
CREATE TYPE "public"."continents" AS enum (
    'Africa',
    'Antarctica',
    'Asia',
    'Europe',
    'Oceania',
    'North America',
    'South America'
);

CREATE TABLE "public"."countries" (
    "id" bigint generated by DEFAULT AS identity NOT NULL,
    "name" text,
    "iso2" text NOT NULL,
    "iso3" text,
    "local_name" text,
    "continent" continents
);


CREATE UNIQUE INDEX countries_pkey ON public.countries USING btree (id);

ALTER TABLE "public"."countries"
ADD CONSTRAINT "countries_pkey" PRIMARY KEY USING INDEX "countries_pkey";

-- Everything below this line is missing from the migration, but ought to be present.
COMMENT ON TABLE countries IS 'Full list of countries.';
COMMENT ON COLUMN countries.name IS 'Full country name.';
COMMENT ON COLUMN countries.iso2 IS 'ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.';
COMMENT ON COLUMN countries.iso3 IS 'ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code.';
COMMENT ON COLUMN countries.local_name IS 'Local variation of the name.';
```

## Actual behaviour

None of the 5 `COMMENT ON *` lines quoted above exist in the migration file created when using `supabase db diff`.

## System information

- OS: Debian 11
- Chrome 110.0.5481.177
- Version of supabase cli: 1.40.1
- Version of supabase-js: 2.10.0
- Version of Node.js: v18.12.1

## Additional context

I've tried using all 3 of `supabase db diff`, `supabase db diff --use-migra` and `supabase db diff --use-pgadmin`, but none of the generated migration files contain the expected comment lines.

metadata.title: Supabase migrations don't include table/column comments
metadata.creator: dawnmist

page_content:
# Improve documentation

## Link 

https://supabase.com/docs/reference/javascript/auth-setsession

## Describe the problem

- There's some wording which implies you only need a `refresh_token` to use this method - which is the legacy way. This is also in the Notes section drop-down.
- This sentence - `setSession` takes in a refresh token and uses it to get a new session. - is probably not correct. I don't believe this method exists to get a new session, as that's what `refreshSession` now does, but literally sets the session for the supabase client. Any session refresh which happens from `setSession` is almost more of a sidebar courtesy, rather than the main purpose of the method.

## Describe the improvement

Just clear up a few inconsistencies.

metadata.title: Docs: Javascript client's setSession page has a few issues
metadata.creator: j4w8n

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

After completing the [getting started tutorial with Sveltekit](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/getting-started/tutorials/with-sveltekit), and confirming everything was working locally, I chose to deploy the project in Vercel. First, I followed the [integration tutorial](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/integrations/vercel) and added my env vars to the project settings in Vercel. It deployed successfully but the `PUBLIC_` env vars returned `undefined` in production. A small change to the `supabaseClient.ts` mitigated that:
```typescript
import { createClient } from '@supabase/auth-helpers-sveltekit';
import { PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL } from '$env/static/public';

export const supabase = createClient(PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL, PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY);
```
> The above could be a proposed change to [the tutorial docs](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/blob/master/apps/docs/pages/guides/getting-started/tutorials/with-sveltekit.mdx), L52-55. The change: instead of importing the `env` object from `$env/dynamic/public`, import the env vars directly from `$env/static/public`. This then allowed the env vars to be defined correctly once deployed. PR: https://github.com/supabase/supabase/pull/12557

All was smooth until clicking the magic link sign in / sign up that was sent to the test user's email. When clicking the link in the email to sign in, it produces a successful `access_token` but it does not redirect to the deployed domain, instead to `localhost:3000`. Manually changing this in the url to the deployed domain solves this and arrives to the authenticated page correctly. The main issue here lies in the incorrect domain in a production environment. Is there a setting or a configuration I'm missing? I apologize if this was too long-winded or if there's a naive solution to this. Thank you.

## To Reproduce

1. Complete the [getting started tutorial with Sveltekit](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/getting-started/tutorials/with-sveltekit)
2. Follow the code change described above by directly importing the public env vars from `$env/static/public` instead of importing the env object from `$env/dynamic/public`
3. Prepare deployment environment in Vercel by loosely following the [integration tutorial](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/integrations/vercel) and by adding the env vars to the project's settings
4. Deploy
5. Send magic link from form
6. Go to email, click on link
7. Arrive at the unexpected `http://localhost:3000/#access_token=...`, not being redirected to the authenticated page on the app

## Expected behavior

Click on the magic link to login to the deployed environment and arrive directly on the authenticated page, not the unexpected localhost page.

## System information

- OS: macOS
- Browser (if applies): brave (chromium)
- Version of supabase-js: 2.8.0
- Version of Node.js: v16.17.0

metadata.title: Sveltekit tutorial - hiccups with deploying with Vercel
metadata.creator: jdshaeffer

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

`CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER ...` is valid syntax since PostgreSQL 14 ([see](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/14/sql-createtrigger.html)). Such queries work in Supabase databases when executed via `psql`. However, such a query is not accepted by the SQL editor on app.supabase.com:

```none
Failed to validate sql query: syntax error at or near "TRIGGER"
```

## To Reproduce

1. Go to any of your projects on app.supabase.com
2. Click on "SQL Editor" in the left column.
3. Enter and execute a valid `CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER` query, such as:

    ```sql
    CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER insert_profile AFTER INSERT ON auth.users
    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION public.insert_profile();
    ```

## Expected behavior

The Supabase SQL Editor should accept the query, since it's valid SQL. It probably needs to be updated. Similar problems may exist with other syntax that is valid since PostgreSQL 14 (or even earlier).

metadata.title: CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER does not validate in SQL editor
metadata.creator: tanius

# Bug report

## Describe the bug

When using firefox (108.0.1) and being within the SQL editor in studio, copying text from one snippet to another snippet deletes text content and creates strange text indenting.

## To Reproduce
1. Login to studio using firefox (tested with version 108.0.1)
2. Create the "User Management Starter" snippet via the "welcome / quick start" page
3. Create a new empty snippet
4. Copy all the text from "User Management Starter" (ctrl+a, ctrl+c / or context menu "copy")
5. Paste it (ctrl+v / or context menu "paste") into the empty snippet

The result is:
- compared to chromium (109.0.5414.74) there's a strange delay before text ends up being pasted
- the text is missing various lines
- the text has some strange indention going on (see screenshot)

## Expected behavior
The expected behaviour would be that the copied text gets pasted "as is" into the empty snippet / into an external text editor.

## Screenshots
Desired:
![bug_supabase_firefox_sql_editor_copy_paste__desired](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6132877/219148809-e3de354b-85f9-477c-9d32-e7fa9c6bff76.png)

Actual (issue):
![bug_supabase_firefox_sql_editor_copy_paste](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6132877/219147973-fa477394-9472-45c8-9951-786e0f5af410.png)


## System information
- OS: Manjaro Linux
- Browser: firefox (108.0.1)


## Additional context
Judging by the fact that when pasting to an external text editor (GVIM, mousepad) the text content gets "partially deleted" the same way, but the indention isn't "progressively increased" (see scrennshot), one can assume that there's an issue with both the 'copy' and the 'paste' action within the SQL editor.
Within chromium (109.0.5414.74) it works just fine.

metadata.title: SQL editor: copy/paste issue on firefox
metadata.creator: Goli4thus

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

When creating a RLS policy using the supabase.com Studio UI, you can add comments `/* … */` and indentation for clarity. But after saving the RLS policy, both are removed. When opening it again to edit it, indentation has been replaced by auto-generated indentation that is hard to read for more complex RLS policies (say, involving joins). In addition, many pairs of auto-generated parentheses have been added that also make the code harder to read.

Example for a CHECK expression as I entered it into the RLS policy dialog:

```sql
/* Allow updating project steps only if user is the project manager. */
EXISTS ( 
    SELECT role.user_id
    FROM project
        JOIN role ON project.id = role.project_id
    WHERE 
        project.id = step.project_id AND 
        role.manager AND 
        role.user_id = auth.uid()
)
```

And this is how the same expression looks after saving and re-opening the editor:

```sql
(EXISTS ( SELECT role.user_id
   FROM (project
     JOIN role ON ((project.id = role.project_id)))
  WHERE (((project.id = step.project_id) AND (role.manager) AND (role.user_id = auth.uid())))))
```

(The same issue could be raised for VIEWs, but that has to wait until Studio UI adds support for creating them. So far, it's rather a PostgreSQL issue, as PostgreSQL itself does not preserve the original code used to create VIEWs.)

## Expected behavior

Both comments and indentation should be preserved. If it is not possible to preserve indentation, the auto-indentation algorithm should be improved.

As for VIEWs, where PostgreSQL does not preserve the original code used to create the view, this is seemingly intended behavior on the side of PostgreSQL and unlikely to change. In a [discussion on the PostgreSQL mailing list](http://www.postgresql.org/message-id/CAAQkdDod-N6nPbCKZ12zxjmYND=8tak3cZyJN40hELEbEfcw0A@mail.gmail.com), it has been [recommended](https://www.postgresql.org/message-id/CAFj8pRCY0Z%3Ds_SbC8W6Bbei3GRn4dJJ%2BahjH_4-tSgrbAkbUkQ%40mail.gmail.com) for such a case to use an external IDE tool to preserve the code in its original form. Now Studio UI seems to aspire to be such an IDE; so I think there's room to argue that it should keep a copy of the original source code used to create the view, or in the scope of this issue report, the RLS policy.

## System information

Using the software version on app.supabase.com as of today.

## Additional context

As a workaround, you can move all the RLS code to a function. For functions, both comments and custom indentation are preserved.

metadata.title: Linebreaks and comments are not preserved for RLS policies
metadata.creator: tanius

page_content:
# Chore

## Describe the chore

I think the `keyauth_credentials` for the `anon` and `service_role` keys in the Docker Kong configuration should reference the existing environment variables `ANON_KEY` and `SERVICE_ROLE_KEY` respectively, rather than being hardcoded. 

https://github.com/supabase/supabase/blob/master/docker/volumes/api/kong.yml#L8-L12

## Additional context

I came across this when I was attempting to create my own JWT_SECRET which required me to regenerate the `ANON_KEY` and `SERVICE_ROLE_KEY`. This resulted in the Supabase Studio web client not being able to connect to the default project because it was using the hardcoded values instead of the environment variables in `kong.yml`.

metadata.title: Reference environment variables in Docker's kong.yml
metadata.creator: JoshElias

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

When I update my database password, the `SUPABASE_DB_URL` secret in the edge functions' Deno environment is not updated.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Update your project database password from the Supabase dashboard
2. Call an edge function that uses the `SUPABASE_DB_URL` secret
3. The password in the `SUPABASE_DB_URL` secret is not up-to-date

## Expected behavior

Since `SUPABASE_DB_URL` is provided by Supabase by default (and that great!), I would expect it to be in sync with the actual database properties, and not to have to maintain it manually.

## Additional context

For now my work around is to set `SUPABASE_DB_URL` manually through `supabase secrets set`.

metadata.title: Edge Functions: SUPABASE_DB_URL secret not up-to-date

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

Attempting to create a continuous aggregate using the TimescaleDB extension (https://docs.timescale.com/getting-started/latest/create-cagg/create-cagg-basics/) on a cloud-hosted Supabase database fails due to lack of support under current Apache license. 

This is a core feature of TimescaleDB.

## To Reproduce

1. Follow the TimescaleDB 'Getting started' tutorial at https://docs.timescale.com/getting-started/latest/
2. Attempt to create a continuous aggregate with the script below
3. See error: `Failed to run sql query: functionality not supported under the current "apache" license`

Script from step 2:
```sql
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW stock_candlestick_minutes
WITH (timescaledb.continuous) AS
SELECT
  time_bucket('1 minute', "time") AS minute,
  symbol,
  max(price) AS high,
  min(price) AS low
FROM stocks_real_time srt
GROUP BY minute, symbol;
```

## Expected behavior

The continuous aggregate is created.

## Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44712417/218231273-152d3f79-6658-472c-860b-6cb29b39fb38.png)

## System information

- Current cloud defaults

## Additional context

metadata.title: TimescaleDB extension:  Continuous aggregates are not supported
metadata.creator: samfweb

page_content:
## Link 

https://supabase.com/docs/guides/integrations/prisma

## Describe the problem

From @rogadev:
- Location of database connection string is now different. The UI has changed since the screenshot was added into these docs (see first screenshot on the page).
- I didn't see any mention of `npx prisma init` which could be helpful. If readers already have a project setup, they're likely not going to want to generate a new project to follow this tutorial. It would be good to show them how to plug Prisma & Supabase into their existing project.
- In the docs it says to run `prisma dev --name init` which I'm pretty sure is supposed to say run `npx prisma dev --name init`. In either case it seems this is no longer the correct command, as doing so creates the following error: "Prisma CLI does not include a `dev` command any more right now."
- I'm fairly certain it would be a good idea to make sure to add the `auth` table, so that users can use a User ID as a foreign key on tables they create. This is a popular design pattern. Nothing that I can see in this documentation handles that.

## Additional context

https://github.com/supabase/supabase/pull/12212

metadata.title: Prisma integration guide is outdated
metadata.creator: dannykng

page_content: # Bug report ## Describe the bug A clear and concise description of what the bug is. ## To Reproduce 1. Go to the SQL editor and enter this code: ```sql select 1 as a, 2 as b; ``` 2. highlight `as` on the second line and hit `⌘-/`, the code becomes: ```sql select -- 1 as a, 2 as b; ``` Which is valid SQL. 3. hit `⌘-Enter` to submit the query Error message: `Failed to validate sql query: syntax error at or near "as"` It would seem that the editor can get itself into a state where the SQL visible to the user is not the same SQL that gets executed on `⌘-Enter`. Moving the cursor or clicking anywhere in the editor is sufficient to fix this state: 4. Press an arrow key to move the cursor, then hit `⌘-Enter` again to submit the query. The query is now successful. ## Expected behavior The executed SQL should always be the same as the visible SQL. ## Screenshots ## System information - OS: macOS - Browser: tested on Safari and Chrome - this happens both on the current app.supabase.com and latest version of the supabase npm package ## Additional context As you can see in the above screenshot, highlighting the `as` word leads to two highlight markers on the screen, one over the letters and one a couple of lines below. I'm not sure if this is connected or a different issue.

metadata.title: Using the "comment current line" and "run" keyboard shortcuts in the SQL editor leads to invisible syntax errors
metadata.creator: BernieSumption

page_content:
# Bug report
Tried dumping Firestore collection but instead got 0 records and thus I could not import JSON file to Supabase (got an `]` character in the output json file instead.

## Describe the bug
This is supposed to be trivial but I couldn't migrate all the collections from Firebase to Supabase. I'm following the article below:
https://supabase.com/docs/guides/resources/migrating-to-supabase/firestore-data
I added `supabase-service.json` and `firebase-service.json` to the `firestore` folder.  However, I can't seem to dump the collections already. The `collections.js` script correctly I identified that I have 3 collections, but 0 records were written to the collections json file I created so I can't import the JSON to Supabase at all.


A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
See bug report.


## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Go to https://supabase.com/docs/guides/resources/migrating-to-supabase/firestore-data
2. Follow the steps until you get to `Command line options` section
3. run `node collections.js`
4. run `node firestore2json.js my_collection`
5. At this point your output should look like:
```
(base) Vincents-MacBook-Pro:firestore vincentlu$ node collections.js
collection1
collection2
collection3
(base) Vincents-MacBook-Pro:firestore vincentlu$ node firestore2json.js my_collection
0 records written to my_collection.json
(base) Vincents-MacBook-Pro:firestore vincentlu$
```

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

Deploying a fully functioning Deno app (with certain imports) to Supabase Edge Functions (local dev) causes ~80 TypeScript errors.
- This does NOT happen when running locally (manual `deno run ...`)
- This happens ONLY when served in Edge Function

When running the script locally with Deno, this does NOT happen. Tested with Deno versions 1.29.4 (latest), and 1.28.0 (the one Edge Functions use).

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:

1. Clone https://github.com/renodesu/supabase-edge-function-deno-error-demo (or minimally replicate a local supabase env - the relevant part is the import of `graphgl-yoga` at https://github.com/renodesu/supabase-edge-function-deno-error-demo/blob/main/supabase/functions/error-test/index.ts#L6)
2. Run `npm install` to install deps
3. Verify the code works when running locally with Deno: `deno run supabase/functions/error-test/index.ts` (`Hello from Functions!` is printed)
4. Run `npx supabase start` to get the local supabase up
5. Run `npx supabase functions serve error-test`
6. Observe multiple TS errors on conflicting types
7. Bonus: Comment out the import to verify the import is the source.

## Expected behavior

Valid code should work without errors as expeted.

This seems to only an issue when running in an Edge Function. All `graphql-yoga` examples work out of the box on plain Deno, which leads me to think this is most likely a supabase/Edge Function issue, since the types are not conflicting when running locally.

## Screenshots

No screenshots.

## System information

- OS: Win11, WSL2
- supabase CLI: 1.34.5

## Additional context

Add any other context about the problem here.

metadata.title: Valid Deno code causes TS errors when deployed to edge function
metadata.creator: renodesu

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

I'm assuming image resizing is available for local development.

I get the following error when I try to resize the image during local development. However standard images are shown as expected. 

**Works as expected:** `http://localhost:54321/storage/v1/object/public/menu-images/public/avatar1.jpg`

**Returns 422:** `http://localhost:54321/storage/v1/render/image/public/menu-images/public/avatar1.jpg?width=100&height=100`

```js
{
statusCode: "422",
error: "ImageProcessingError",
message: "Invalid source image"
}
```

## To Reproduce

1. Create bucket `menu-images`
```sql
INSERT INTO storage.buckets (id, name, public) VALUES ('menu-images', 'menu-images', true);
CREATE POLICY "Anyone can view menu images" ON "storage"."objects" FOR SELECT TO authenticated USING ((bucket_id = 'menu-images'));
CREATE POLICY "Anyone can add menu images" ON "storage"."objects" FOR INSERT TO authenticated WITH CHECK ((bucket_id = 'menu-images'));
```
2. Upload a file
```js
const { error } = await supabase.storage.from("menu-images").upload(`public/avatar1.jpg`, fileItem.file);
```

3. Get transformed public URL:
```js
const { data } = supabase.storage.from("menu-images").getPublicUrl("public/avatar1.jpg", {
  transform: {
    width: 100,
    height: 100,
  },
});
```

4. Go to `http://localhost:54321/storage/v1/render/image/public/menu-images/public/avatar1.jpg?width=100&height=100`

## Expected behavior

Get resized image.

## System information

- OS: macOS
- Version of supabase-js: 2.2.2
- Version of Node.js: 19.4.0

metadata.title: Error 422 when resize image during local development
metadata.creator: ozum

page_content:
# Improve documentation

## Link 

[Generating types, update types github action](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/api/generating-types#update-types-automatically-with-github-actions)

## Describe the problem

The Github Actions workflow script provided in this link is slightly outdated. As of recently Node.js 12 actions are deprecated, the following errors are displayed when running the build
```
Node.js 12 actions are deprecated. Please update the following actions to use Node.js 16: actions/checkout@v2, actions/setup-node@v2.1.5. For more information see: https://github.blog/changelog/2022-09-22-github-actions-all-actions-will-begin-running-on-node16-instead-of-node12/.

The `set-output` command is deprecated and will be disabled soon. Please upgrade to using Environment Files. For more information see: https://github.blog/changelog/2022-10-11-github-actions-deprecating-save-state-and-set-output-commands/
```

## Describe the improvement

As mentioned in the links provided by the errors as well as this issue [here](https://github.com/actions/checkout/issues/959#issuecomment-1342479774), the versions need to be changed to ``actions/checkout@v3`` and ``actions/setup-node@v3``. However, I currently still receive the same errors and it might be due to not updating the ``set-output`` command as described in the error warning link mentioning the upgrade to Environment files.

metadata.title: Generating types Github Action depreciated Node version
metadata.creator: Stan-l-e-y

## Describe the bug
`ALTER PUBLICATION` [syntax](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/sql-alterpublication.html) not fully supported in dashboard.

## To Reproduce

Trying to run
```SQL
ALTER PUBLICATION supabase_realtime ADD TABLE auth.users (id, raw_app_meta_data);
```
in the dashboard, gives me a `Failed to validate sql query: syntax error at or near "("` error. 

## Expected behavior
However, in `psql` I get success:
```SQL
postgres=> ALTER PUBLICATION supabase_realtime ADD TABLE auth.users (id, raw_app_meta_data);
ALTER PUBLICATION
```

## Context
This probably also applies to `CREATE PUBLICATION` and variants like `ALTER PUBLICATION ... SET TABLE`.

page_content:
## What kind of change does this PR introduce?

DX feature!

## What is the current behavior?

Currently, there's a `tsc` check at the root of the repo for type checking this monorepo.

This works! But, with `turbo` in the mix...

## What is the new behavior?

Type checking the monorepo `turbo` style! This incremental adoption shouldn't have too much impact on the repo by itself - but does open us up to surface and fix type errors more easily!

- Parallelized `tsc` per workspace
- Caching once we start having successful runs

I've also add a GitHub Action to this PR if the core team would like to use it for checks. Completely optional, of course!

## Additional context

This PR only adds the type checking commands but does not resolve the errors that it surfaces. With this change, we'll find many opportunities for better codebase health. Incremental adoption with followup PRs to clear errors is best in this case! 😄

metadata.title: turbo type-check command and GHA
metadata.creator: anthonyshew

  kong:
    container_name: supabase-kong
    image: kong:2.8.1
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - ${KONG_HTTP_PORT}:8000/tcp
      - ${KONG_HTTPS_PORT}:8443/tcp
    environment:
      KONG_DATABASE: "off"

page_content:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

If you create a delete cascade constraint on a table with SQL and then later use the UI to rename the table, the rename succeeds without error.  Then if you delete an item in the "parent" table you get:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54564956/205074815-edbdd62f-6f9c-4120-b293-1709792e421c.png)

The problem is no error was generated during the rename and if you start testing deletes much later, there is little evidence to suggest the problem was the rename.  This has cost users much time in debugging in Discord.

## To Reproduce
Create a table called profiles with a foreign key to auth.users and delete cascade:

```
create table profiles
(
    id  uuid  not null
        constraint profiles_pkey   primary key
        constraint profiles_id_fkey references auth.users on delete cascade,
    username   varchar(24)  not null
        constraint profiles_username_key unique
        constraint usernamevalidation
            check ((username)::text ~* '^[A-Za-z0-9]{3,24}$'::text),
    created_at timestamp with time zone default timezone('utc'::text, now()) not null
);
```
Deleting a user  from auth.users works.

Rename the table in the UI to profile.

This is the SQL now for the table when examined by Datagrip:
```
create table profile
(
    id  uuid  not null
        constraint profiles_pkey  primary key constraint profile_id_fkey references auth.users
    username   varchar(24)  not null
        constraint profiles_username_key unique
        constraint usernamevalidation
            check ((username)::text ~* '^[A-Za-z0-9]{3,24}$'::text),
    created_at timestamp with time zone default timezone('utc'::text, now()) not null
);
```
The delete cascade is missing.
Delete a user from auth.users and an error occurs.

## Expected behavior
Either convert constraints correctly, or at least flag a message about the risk of renaming a table with the UI if you have custom constraints.


Related Discord link:  https://discord.com/channels/839993398554656828/1047551552728084571

metadata.title: Renaming table in UI loses delete cascade fk constraint
metadata.creator: GaryAustin1

page_content:
# Improve documentation

## Link 
https://supabase.com/docs/reference/cli/usage#supabase-db-push
https://supabase.com/docs/guides/cli/managing-environments

## Describe the problem
Supabase migrations seem to depend on a certain naming convention of the SQL migration file.

For example:
500.1_table.sql 
500.2_functions.sql 
**creates an error:**
Error: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "schema_migrations_pkey" (SQLSTATE 23505); while inserting migration 

5001_table.sql 
5002_functions.sql 
not.

I think Supabase creates a migration schema 'schema_migrations'. That table includes a row 'version', derived from migration file names.

If the same table is deleted first, and 'supabase db push' is called after, then the database is reset (as far as I can see).

## Describe the improvement
Clear how to name migrations to not run in the described error above.

## Additional context
I also could not find or did not understand any documentation how to reset a remote instance to local migration files (.sql). I think this could be a useful feature for regression tests or resetting daily test environments.

I added a file as a workarround which resets my remote instance but I guess there should be a more sophisticated way of doing it:

```
DROP SCHEMA if exists public CASCADE;
CREATE SCHEMA public;
DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS trigger_migration_row_delete ON supabase_migrations.schema_migrations;
DROP FUNCTION IF EXISTS supabase_migrations.signup_copy_to_users_table();

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION supabase_migrations.delete_migration_versions()
RETURNS TRIGGER AS $$
  BEGIN
    DELETE FROM supabase_migrations.schema_migrations;
    RETURN NEW;
  END;
$$
LANGUAGE plpgsql SECURITY DEFINER;
ALTER FUNCTION supabase_migrations.delete_migration_versions() OWNER to postgres;


CREATE TRIGGER trigger_migration_row_delete
AFTER INSERT ON supabase_migrations.schema_migrations
FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE PROCEDURE supabase_migrations.delete_migration_versions();

```

metadata.title: Improve documentation about naming conventions for supabase db push or reset remote migrations in general
metadata.creator: Donnerstagnacht

page_content:
# Improve documentation

## Link 

[Typescript Support](https://supabase.com/docs/reference/javascript/typescript-support#type-hints)

> `supabase-js` always returns a `data` object (for success), and an `error` response (for unsuccessful requests).

## Describe the problem

`Prefer: return=minimal` is set by default now.

- https://github.com/supabase/postgrest-js/pull/276

Therefore, if `.select()` is not chained, successful requests return `null` for both `data` and `error`.

## Describe the improvement

Current documentation is technically correct - successful requests do return `data` object of `null` or an array.

However, being more explicit would not hurt.

> `supabase-js` always returns a `data` array (for successful requests with `.select()` chained) …

## Additional context

The following code will always throw an error for both successful and unsuccessful requests.

```javascript
const { data, error } = await supabase
  .from('countries')
  .insert({ id: 1, name: 'Denmark' });

if (!data || error) throw new Error();
```

Successful responses used to return an `data` array, so the above code was valid in `v1`.

- https://github.com/supabase/supabase-js/issues/32

metadata.title: Specify that `data` object can be `null`
metadata.creator: hyunbinseo
